title: AI Discovers ‘Potentially Hazardous’ Near Earth Asteroid Astronomers Missed
summary: In a significant breakthrough for space exploration and safety, an asteroid discovery algorithm designed for the Vera C. Rubin Observatory's has successfully identified its first "potentially hazardous" asteroid.

title: US To Investigate China's Remote Sensing Technology Advancements
summary: In a move underscoring heightened concerns over China's advancements in remote sensing technologies, the United States–China Economic and Security Review Commission has issued a request for proposals from companies capable of producing an unclassified report on China's remote sensing capabilities.

title: China Planning 2nd LEO Broadband Megaconstellation Called G60 Starlink
summary: The Shanghai Municipal People’s Government has thrown its support behind an ambitious broadband megaconstellation project, known as "G60 Starlink," which aims to deploy a vast network of satellites to provide global internet coverage. Officials unveiled plans for the initiative during press conference on July 25.

title: Sierra Space Establishes New Engineering & Test Organization
summary: Sierra Space has announced the establishment of a cutting-edge engineering and test organization aimed at driving unprecedented advancements in space technology and products for both commercial and government clients.

title: True Anomaly Partners With Redwire For Jackal Spacecraft Cameras
summary: True Anomaly has announced a deal with Redwire to equip their Jackal spacecraft with Redwires state-of-the-art navigation and sensing cameras which are slated to launch in early 2024.

title: GHGSat orders four more greenhouse gas monitoring cubesats from Spire
summary: GHGSat has ordered another four 16U cubesats from Spire Global for a launch no earlier than 2024 to expand its greenhouse gas-monitoring constellation, the Canadian satellite operator announced Aug. 8.

title: Artemis II On Track, But Artemis III Could Be a “Different Mission” if Hardware Not Ready
summary: NASA said today the next two missions in NASA’s program to return astronauts the Moon, Artemis II and Artemis III, remain on track for launch in late 2024 and late […]

title: Dish Network & EchoStar Announce Merger
summary: DISH Network Corporation (Nasdaq: DISH) and EchoStar Corporation (Nasdaq: SATS) have officially entered into a definitive agreement to merge in an all-stock transaction, combining their strengths to create a dynamic force in the world of wireless connectivity and satellite communications.

title: Eutelsat Partners With Thaicom To Launch GEO Telecom Sat
summary: Eutelsat, the French satellite fleet operator has announced a collaboration with a regional satellite operator in Thailand to commission a high throughput geostationary telecom spacecraft intended to serve Asia's growing connectivity demands.

title: Rocket Lab results match Wall Street estimates, company adds contracts for 10 launches
summary: Rocket Lab on Tuesday reported second-quarter results that largely met Wall Street’s expectations, and the company said it added contracts for 10 more launches in 2023 and 2024.
